trans-unit.target: Is this the right control?

trans-unit.source: Use a slider when you want your users to be able to set defined, contiguous values (such as volume or brightness) or a range of discrete values (such as screen resolution settings).
trans-unit.target: Use a slider when you want your users to be able to set defined, contiguous values (such as volume or brightness) or a range of discrete values (such as screen resolution settings).

trans-unit.source: A slider is a good choice when you know that users think of the value as a relative quantity, not a numeric value.
trans-unit.target: A slider is a good choice when you know that users think of the value as a relative quantity, not a numeric value.

trans-unit.source: For example, users think about setting their audio volume to low or medium—not about setting the value to 2 or 5.
trans-unit.target: For example, users think about setting their audio volume to low or medium—not about setting the value to 2 or 5.

trans-unit.source: Don't use a slider for binary settings.
trans-unit.target: Don't use a slider for binary settings.

trans-unit.source: Use a [toggle switch](toggles.md) instead.
trans-unit.target: Use a [toggle switch](toggles.md) instead.

trans-unit.source: Here are some additional factors to consider when deciding whether to use a slider:
trans-unit.target: Here are some additional factors to consider when deciding whether to use a slider:

trans-unit.source: Does the setting seem like a relative quantity?
trans-unit.target: Does the setting seem like a relative quantity?

trans-unit.source: If not, use [radio buttons](radio-button.md) or a [list box](lists.md).
trans-unit.target: If not, use [radio buttons](radio-button.md) or a [list box](lists.md).

trans-unit.source: Is the setting an exact, known numeric value?
trans-unit.target: Is the setting an exact, known numeric value?

trans-unit.source: If so, use a numeric [text box](text-box.md).
trans-unit.target: If so, use a numeric [text box](text-box.md).

trans-unit.source: Would a user benefit from instant feedback on the effect of setting changes?
trans-unit.target: Would a user benefit from instant feedback on the effect of setting changes?

trans-unit.source: If so, use a slider.
trans-unit.target: If so, use a slider.

trans-unit.source: For example, users can choose a color more easily by immediately seeing the effect of changes to hue, saturation, or luminosity values.
trans-unit.target: For example, users can choose a color more easily by immediately seeing the effect of changes to hue, saturation, or luminosity values.

trans-unit.source: Does the setting have a range of four or more values?
trans-unit.target: Does the setting have a range of four or more values?

trans-unit.source: If not, use [radio buttons](radio-button.md).
trans-unit.target: If not, use [radio buttons](radio-button.md).

trans-unit.source: Can the user change the value?
trans-unit.target: Can the user change the value?

trans-unit.source: Sliders are for user interaction.
trans-unit.target: Sliders are for user interaction.

trans-unit.source: If a user can't ever change the value, use read-only text instead.
trans-unit.target: If a user can't ever change the value, use read-only text instead.

trans-unit.source: If you are deciding between a slider and a numeric text box, use a numeric text box if:
trans-unit.target: If you are deciding between a slider and a numeric text box, use a numeric text box if:

trans-unit.source: Screen space is tight.
trans-unit.target: Screen space is tight.

trans-unit.source: The user is likely to prefer using the keyboard.
trans-unit.target: The user is likely to prefer using the keyboard.

trans-unit.source: Use a slider if:
trans-unit.target: Use a slider if:

trans-unit.source: Users will benefit from instant feedback.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: Size the control so that users can easily set the value they want.
trans-unit.target: Size the control so that users can easily set the value they want.

trans-unit.source: For settings with discrete values, make sure the user can easily select any value using the mouse.
trans-unit.target: For settings with discrete values, make sure the user can easily select any value using the mouse.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the endpoints of the slider always fit within the bounds of a view.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the endpoints of the slider always fit within the bounds of a view.

trans-unit.source: Give immediate feedback while or after a user makes a selection (when practical).
trans-unit.target: Give immediate feedback while or after a user makes a selection (when practical).

trans-unit.source: For example, the Windows volume control beeps to indicate the selected audio volume.
trans-unit.target: For example, the Windows volume control beeps to indicate the selected audio volume.

trans-unit.source: Use labels to show the range of values.
trans-unit.target: Use labels to show the range of values.

trans-unit.source: Exception: If the slider is vertically oriented and the top label is Maximum, High, More, or equivalent, you can omit the other labels because the meaning is clear.
trans-unit.target: Exception: If the slider is vertically oriented and the top label is Maximum, High, More, or equivalent, you can omit the other labels because the meaning is clear.

trans-unit.source: Disable all associated labels or feedback visuals when you disable the slider.
trans-unit.target: Disable all associated labels or feedback visuals when you disable the slider.

trans-unit.source: Consider the direction of text when setting the flow direction and/or orientation of your slider.
trans-unit.target: Consider the direction of text when setting the flow direction and/or orientation of your slider.

trans-unit.source: Script flows from left to right in some languages, and from right to left in others.
trans-unit.target: Script flows from left to right in some languages, and from right to left in others.

trans-unit.source: Don't use a slider as a progress indicator.
trans-unit.target: Don't use a slider as a progress indicator.

trans-unit.source: Don't change the size of the slider thumb from the default size.
trans-unit.target: Don't change the size of the slider thumb from the default size.

trans-unit.source: Don't create a continuous slider if the range of values is large and users will most likely select one of several representative values from the range.
trans-unit.target: Don't create a continuous slider if the range of values is large and users will most likely select one of several representative values from the range.

trans-unit.source: Instead, use those values as the only steps allowed.
trans-unit.target: Instead, use those values as the only steps allowed.

trans-unit.source: For example if time value might be up to 1 month but users only need to pick from 1 minute, 1 hour, 1 day or 1 month, then create a slider with only 4 step points.
trans-unit.target: For example if time value might be up to 1 month but users only need to pick from 1 minute, 1 hour, 1 day or 1 month, then create a slider with only 4 step points.

trans-unit.source: Choosing the right layout: horizontal or vertical
trans-unit.target: Choosing the right layout: horizontal or vertical

trans-unit.source: You can orient your slider horizontally or vertically.
trans-unit.target: You can orient your slider horizontally or vertically.

trans-unit.source: Use these guidelines to determine which layout to use.
trans-unit.target: Use these guidelines to determine which layout to use.

trans-unit.source: Use a natural orientation.
trans-unit.target: Use a natural orientation.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the slider represents a real-world value that is normally shown vertically (such as temperature), use a vertical orientation.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the slider represents a real-world value that is normally shown vertically (such as temperature), use a vertical orientation.

trans-unit.source: If the control is used to seek within media, like in a video app, use a horizontal orientation.
trans-unit.target: If the control is used to seek within media, like in a video app, use a horizontal orientation.

trans-unit.source: When using a slider in page that can be panned in one direction (horizontally or vertically), use a different orientation for the slider than the panning direction.
trans-unit.target: When using a slider in page that can be panned in one direction (horizontally or vertically), use a different orientation for the slider than the panning direction.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, users might swipe the slider and change its value accidentally when they try to pan the page.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, users might swipe the slider and change its value accidentally when they try to pan the page.

trans-unit.source: If you're still not sure which orientation to use, use the one that best fits your page layout.
trans-unit.target: If you're still not sure which orientation to use, use the one that best fits your page layout.

trans-unit.source: Range direction
trans-unit.target: Range direction

trans-unit.source: The range direction is the direction you move the slider when you slide it from its current value to its max value.
trans-unit.target: The range direction is the direction you move the slider when you slide it from its current value to its max value.

trans-unit.source: For vertical slider, put the largest value at the top of the slider, regardless of reading direction.
trans-unit.target: For vertical slider, put the largest value at the top of the slider, regardless of reading direction.

trans-unit.source: For example, for a volume slider, always put the maximum volume setting at the top of the slider.
trans-unit.target: For example, for a volume slider, always put the maximum volume setting at the top of the slider.

trans-unit.source: For other types of values (such as days of the week), follow the reading direction of the page.
trans-unit.target: For other types of values (such as days of the week), follow the reading direction of the page.

trans-unit.source: For horizontal styles, put the lower value on the left side of the slider for left-to-right page layout, and on the right for right-to-left page layout.
trans-unit.target: For horizontal styles, put the lower value on the left side of the slider for left-to-right page layout, and on the right for right-to-left page layout.

trans-unit.source: The one exception to the previous guideline is for media seek bars: always put the lower value on the left side of the slider.
trans-unit.target: The one exception to the previous guideline is for media seek bars: always put the lower value on the left side of the slider.

trans-unit.source: Steps and tick marks
trans-unit.target: Steps and tick marks

trans-unit.source: Use step points if you don't want the slider to allow arbitrary values between min and max. For example, if you use a slider to specify the number of movie tickets to buy, don't allow floating point values.
trans-unit.target: Use step points if you don't want the slider to allow arbitrary values between min and max. For example, if you use a slider to specify the number of movie tickets to buy, don't allow floating point values.

trans-unit.source: Give it a step value of 1.
trans-unit.target: Give it a step value of 1.

trans-unit.source: If you specify steps (also known as snap points), make sure that the final step aligns to the slider's max value.
trans-unit.target: If you specify steps (also known as snap points), make sure that the final step aligns to the slider's max value.

trans-unit.source: Use tick marks when you want to show users the location of major or significant values.
trans-unit.target: Use tick marks when you want to show users the location of major or significant values.

trans-unit.source: For example, a slider that controls a zoom might have tick marks for 50%, 100%, and 200%.
trans-unit.target: For example, a slider that controls a zoom might have tick marks for 50%, 100%, and 200%.

trans-unit.source: Show tick marks when users need to know the approximate value of the setting.
trans-unit.target: Show tick marks when users need to know the approximate value of the setting.

trans-unit.source: Show tick marks and a value label when users need to know the exact value of the setting they choose, without interacting with the control.
trans-unit.target: Show tick marks and a value label when users need to know the exact value of the setting they choose, without interacting with the control.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, they can use the value tooltip to see the exact value.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, they can use the value tooltip to see the exact value.

trans-unit.source: Always show tick marks when step points aren't obvious.
trans-unit.target: Always show tick marks when step points aren't obvious.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the slider is 200 pixels wide and has 200 snap points, you can hide the tick marks because users won't notice the snapping behavior.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the slider is 200 pixels wide and has 200 snap points, you can hide the tick marks because users won't notice the snapping behavior.

trans-unit.source: But if there are only 10 snap points, show tick marks.
trans-unit.target: But if there are only 10 snap points, show tick marks.

trans-unit.source: The slider label indicates what the slider is used for.

trans-unit.source: Use a label with no ending punctuation (this is the convention for all control labels).
trans-unit.target: Use a label with no ending punctuation (this is the convention for all control labels).

trans-unit.source: Position labels above the slider when the slider is in a form that places most of its labels above their controls.
trans-unit.target: Position labels above the slider when the slider is in a form that places most of its labels above their controls.

trans-unit.source: Position labels to the sides when the slider is in a form that places most of its labels to the side of their controls.
trans-unit.target: Position labels to the sides when the slider is in a form that places most of its labels to the side of their controls.

trans-unit.source: Avoid placing labels below the slider because the user's finger might occlude the label when the user touches the slider.
trans-unit.target: Avoid placing labels below the slider because the user's finger might occlude the label when the user touches the slider.

trans-unit.source: Range labels
trans-unit.target: Range labels

trans-unit.source: The range, or fill, labels describe the slider's minimum and maximum values.
trans-unit.target: The range, or fill, labels describe the slider's minimum and maximum values.

trans-unit.source: Label the two ends of the slider range, unless a vertical orientation makes this unnecessary.
trans-unit.target: Label the two ends of the slider range, unless a vertical orientation makes this unnecessary.

trans-unit.source: Use only one word, if possible, for each label.
trans-unit.target: Use only one word, if possible, for each label.

trans-unit.source: Don't use ending punctuation.
trans-unit.target: Don't use ending punctuation.

trans-unit.source: Make sure these labels are descriptive and parallel.
trans-unit.target: Make sure these labels are descriptive and parallel.

trans-unit.source: Examples: Maximum/Minimum, More/Less, Low/High, Soft/Loud.
trans-unit.target: Examples: Maximum/Minimum, More/Less, Low/High, Soft/Loud.

trans-unit.source: Appearance and interaction
trans-unit.target: Appearance and interaction

trans-unit.source: A slider is composed of a track and a thumb.
trans-unit.target: A slider is composed of a track and a thumb.

trans-unit.source: The track is a bar (which can optionally show various styles of tick marks) representing the range of values that can be input.
trans-unit.target: The track is a bar (which can optionally show various styles of tick marks) representing the range of values that can be input.

trans-unit.source: The thumb is a selector, which the user can position by either tapping the track or by scrubbing back and forth on it.
trans-unit.target: The thumb is a selector, which the user can position by either tapping the track or by scrubbing back and forth on it.

trans-unit.source: A slider has a large touch target.
trans-unit.target: A slider has a large touch target.

trans-unit.source: To maintain touch accessibility, a slider should be positioned far enough away from the edge of the display.
trans-unit.target: To maintain touch accessibility, a slider should be positioned far enough away from the edge of the display.

trans-unit.source: When you’re designing a custom slider, consider ways to present all the necessary info to the user with as little clutter as possible.
trans-unit.target: When you’re designing a custom slider, consider ways to present all the necessary info to the user with as little clutter as possible.

trans-unit.source: Use a value label if a user needs to know the units in order to understand the setting; find creative ways to represent these values graphically.
trans-unit.target: Use a value label if a user needs to know the units in order to understand the setting; find creative ways to represent these values graphically.

trans-unit.source: A slider that controls volume, for example, could display a speaker graphic without sound waves at the minimum end of the slider, and a speaker graphic with sound waves at the maximum end.
